result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew J. Clark

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Cheree
Cases 16CM62 and 16CM63 called: 9:56am
State appears by ADA C.Minder.  Def appears in person with Atty Mort.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW

State moves to:
16CM62>>D&RI file
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA:
16CM63 - Ct. 1>>NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.

COURT ORDERS: Sentence W/held; 1 year probation
CONDITIONS: Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; N/C with WalMart in Marshfield; GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling or any combination thereof, or any time he does not meet that requirement, defendant must perform 10 hours of C.S./week; CC; DNA sample and surcharge.

>>Probation to be transferred to Wood County

Adj: 10:03am

Pre-trial conference at 02-23-2016 10:05 am.
Plea hearing at 03-18-2016 09:50 am.
Final pre-trial at 04-14-2016 10:00 am.
Jury Trial at 05-11-2016 08:15 am.
Dft wants atty; sent to PD office; PTC reset

Includes 16CM62 and 16CM63.    No contact with victim(s):  Walmart in Marshfield.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.    Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.  Absolute sobriety from controlled substances.
